abstract: Federal Judge Richard M Berman denies bail to Reza Zarrab, Turkish gold trader facing charges in Manhattan that include conspiring to violate United States sanctions on Iran; judge rules Zarrab's proposal to live at home under guard with GPS tracking, all at his own expense, is unreasonable and does not guarantee his appearance in court.

headline.print_headline: Judge Rejects Gold Trader’s Request for Self-Financed House Arrest
headline.main: Judge Denies Reza Zarrab’s Bail Request for Self-Financed House Arrest

snippet: Mr. Zarrab, a gold trader from Turkey, had asked to be allowed to live in an apartment under 24-hour armed guard and GPS monitoring, all at his own expense.
